string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: Do you find that you\'ve lost a lot of interest in things you used to be interested in? This can include hobbies, friends, work, food, or sex.
Do you find that a lot of things are no longer enjoyable to you that you previously found enjoyable, or that you simply don\'t go out and try to do enjoyable things anymore?
How often do you ever have feelings of being down or depressed?
Do you ever have feelings of hopelessness?
Have you had problems with falling asleep, staying asleep, or sleeping a lot less in the last two months?
How about on the other hand? Many depressed people often have feelings of lethargy and tend to sleep much more than they normally do.
How often do you feel tired or drained?
One\'s appetite can be a very good indicator of becoming depressed. Have you noticed yourself eating less than you normally do?
How about eating more than you normally do, or binge eating, where you eat a lot of food in a short amount of time?
How often do you have thoughts that you\'re a failure, or that you\'ve let yourself down?
Depression can manifest as difficulty studying or doing homework. Have you had trouble with your concentration lately?
Have you found difficulty finishing tasks you start?
Some people with depression actually feel a sense of physical slowing. Have you felt a sense of physical “slowness” about yourself, like moving slowly?
Have you had anyone comment that you move or talk more slowly than usual?
Do you ever think about hurting yourself in some way, or ending your life?
How about the thought that you\'d be better off dead, or that it would be great to just fall asleep and never wake up?
Would you say you\'ve felt depressed or down for more than two weeks?
In the past year, have you felt depressed or sad most days, even if you felt okay sometimes?
Have any of these symptoms of depression we asked about earlier keep you from being 100% at work, study, or relationships?
Has there been a time in the past month when you have had serious thoughts about ending your life?
Has there ever been a time in your life where you tried to kill yourself?
How understanding would your family be if they knew you had depression?
To what degree do you think your family situation, such as your relationship with your parents, plays or can play a role in your depression?
To what degree do you think your cultural background plays or can play a role in your depression?
Could you see yourself setting up an appointment to go talk with a therapist or psychiatrist about depression?
Would you find talking to a stranger, even though they are a mental health professional, about your depression scary or intimidating?
How adequate and/or supportive are your school\'s mental health resources?

resources.string: One or two days a week
Three to four days a week
I have a hard time seeing myself making an appointment
I can see myself making an appointment
Yes, and it could stop me from getting help
Yes, but it wouldn\'t stop me from getting help
